description:
I got a chicken shawarma  wrap with cucumber yog. It was pretty good. Chicken was decent quality but didn't taste like much. Nice fresh vegetables gave it a good crunch. Ordered it spicy but it was barely mild so get it extra hot if you need spiciness.

Side of falafel tasted like falafel.

I wouldn't seek this place out but would definitely come back if I'm in the area.
author: Johnny R.

description:
Order: gyros - spicy. Result: gyros with no spices, no nothing. Just plain :(

Order: gyros - extra spicy. Result: the stingiest amount of spice.  Disappointing :( 

Spice is not my kryptonite nor have my tastebuds been colonized to only handle pepper. You would think when you ask for spice it would be included. 

Long time customer, very disappointed.
author: A. M.

description:
If you're in SOMA and looking for a late night bite, Oasis Grill will hit the spot. It's not the best Mediterranean food I've ever had, but the gyros, Shawarmas, and falafels here are legit.

On my most recent visit, I ordered the Chicken Shawarma, which is like a Mediterranean burrito served in Lavash bread. Although the meal was tasty, the chicken was a bit sparse and dry... and the whole thing could've benefitted from a bit more spice. But then again, it was 10pm on a Monday night, there were no other fast-casual spots open near my hotel, and I was hungry/bordering on "hangry." So when you take all of that into consideration, Oasis Grill was pretty much Shangri-La.

I'd definitely give them another shot. Maybe next time I'll go for their lamb gyro.
author: Kevin B.

description: Location across from the convention center is how I ended up here. I grabbed 3 wraps. Good sized. Tasty. The foil will leak some sauce. A variation on the typical falafel in that it is in flatbread and not a pita. And they put some hot sauce in. Pleasant service. Clean. I enjoyed the food later on the airplane.
author: Harold L.

description:
Great place and fresh food- 
Best place to eat when at Moscone.

Some of the best falafels and lamb shawarmas !
author: L T.

description:
If you're pressed for time, do not spend money here. They take much too long for the quality of food served. 
Waited 20 minutes to get a mixed grill and 3 falafel to be served. 
This our second  visit to Oasis Grill with similar results. 
Due to the location, choices are limited so there is no choice.
author: Geordie E.

description: On my feet all day at the Moscone and wanted some good eats within walking distance. Noticed Oasis on our way in and decided that would be dinner. Reviews were middle of the road in my opinion, but I said heck why not, I'm tired and hungry so let's give it a whirl. The other reviewers were right in terms of customer service, absolutely no violins with the cashier. She acted like our questions were slightly bothersome (it was crystal clear this was our first dining experience), annoyed look on her face, and she'd rather be doing anything else besides helping hungry folks get some grub. I ordered the lamb and beef gyro which was delicious. Too much lettuce and not enough meat, but it was dee-lish. The pita looked more like a tortilla so I was worried the gyro would disappoint, but it had amazing flavor. Hubby ordered the lamb shawarma, and it knocked my flavor-meter out of the park. Uhmazing taste, I immediately regretted my yummy gyro and wanted a shawarma lol. The sweet potatoes fries (barely a shareable portion) for $4.99 was just plain unacceptable. Not lightly salted, not crunchy (too much oil) which was fine, the price point was out bounds, add some potatoes or reduce the price. Sandwiches were great, totally worth returning but we will not, due to our cashier experience. My hubby who never comments or complains, even mentioned his unwelcome experience with her, so it's pretty bad if he comments lol. There's another Oasis location near our hotel, may try them tomorrow!
author: Candace C.

description: The first time I came the food was amazing, the wraps were delicious, the curly fries were full of flavor and everything was just great. I decided to come here again last Sunday and it was okay. The big guy that took our order was friendly (he let me put ice cream in the freezer) and the rest of them were nice as well. My only problem was with the food, it's not as great as the first time. The kebabs were good but the chicken shawarma were not chicken shawarma, it was shredded chicken mixed with some vegetables. I got two chicken shawarma wraps to go and they were wrapped in tortillas (?), the last time they were wrapped in Greek style pita bread which was way better. All in all, I might go here again because of their service and to try other menu items.
author: Shontelle W.

description: Very rude customer service! As I was placing my order over the phone I told the guy that barely spoke any English I want 3 shawarma and he kept repeating " so you want 3 shawarma right?" Yes yes yes I told you 5 times yes 3 shawarma! Kept me on phone 5 min when this could have been a 30sec phone call. Thought I'd give this place a try since they have multiple locations around me, but I guess there's a reason why all locations are 3 stars or lower! Shut this place down, truly Mediterranean is much better and worth the uber ride to 16th street
author: jay f.

description: The falafel is excellent. It's not the best location but they're super fast and the food is great. Not sure why the 3 star reviews but I've never been disappointed eating here.
author: Ben B.

description:
Super fast service! Made after you order. Light & thin bread, but a little too much for my tastes. Some parts of the wrap had 3 layers of the bread folded on itself. 

I ordered the veggie deluxe, cuz after peeking behind at the counter, I had to try their falafel! It was good, not too fried. You could taste the veggies in it. As for the wrap itself, I loved how much veggies were in it, but would have preferred more grilled eggplant, since that was supposed to be the star of the show. Only had a few pieces which was disappointing. 

They have a large selection of bottled drinks , including kombucha, teas, fruity stuff, and yogurt. I took forever looking at everything, that our wraps were done before I came back with my drink selection :p thats what you call fast service!

Lots of seating available. And tvs playing sports.
author: Angela C.

description:
Oh, man. This review is 6 weeks overdue. My mother and I went to this place six weeks ago from today. We went to Burlington Coat Factory down the block. She remembered that her niece or somebody told her of a Middle Eastern place around the neighborhood and so we went. 

We both ordered Shawarma. I had the chicken and she had the lamb. I could show you better than I could tell you how good it was, so I uploaded a lot of pictures (with captions). I added 14 pictures. 

The price of the meal was about $15, each, which is a better deal than a lot of restaurants who give you far less while demanding more money. After finishing my second Shawarma, I couldn't eat what was left on my tray. We ended up taking ours home.

Would I come back? Oh, hell yea!
author: Justice A.

description:
Walking into San Francisco for an event, a colleague and I were hungry as we headed to our hotel.  Looking at Oasis and seeing their menu, we headed in with a desire to have one of their menu items.  Looking at the diversity of their menu, it truly made us want something they offered.

We both ordered a Lamb Shawarma and ate in true delight.  The various items in it and the lamb made us very pleased with what we ordered. The Lamb Shawarma craved us to come back and eat again. 

Looking at their menu, it ranges from Shawarma and salads to diverse food dishes, side orders as well as desserts (Baklava) and drinks.  With it being Halal and creating a variety of delights, Oasis is truly an asset in every way, shape and form.

Plus, the service was very well and they always ask how you are doing along with what else you might want!!  Next time I head to San Francisco, Oasis will, to paraphrase the 1960's Hippie song " Truly be a favor being there!!"

Bottomline:  As a retired teacher and educator, I grade Oasis with an A+!
author: Steve H.

description:
Stopped by after Movies at Metreon. This place is one block away, we had to try. 
Mixed Grill Plate.
Chicken, Beef, Kefta Kabobs. Greek Yogurt Cucumber Salad, Hummus, Rice and Salad.
Absolutely Delicious. 
Hummus n Salad very tasty. Chicken not dry at all. Kefta was my favorite. 
If I'm in the area, Definitely will return. 
Two thumbs up.
Yummy
author: Pure M.

description: I go there when I need my food quickly. Mixed grill shawarma plate is nice. It has all kind of meat and kabob. Love their sweet, baklava and others. Service is very quick. Normally I get my order in 5-10 mins.
author: Salman M.

description: A decent casual mediterranean food place to grab a quick fix meal to go or to eat there. It reminds me of the kebab places in Germany.
author: Sophie P.

description: Not only is the food here amazing, but they were really helpful and attentive, so definitely a 5/5 for customer service. They were really busy, but I had placed an order online when something went wrong with the website so they never got my order. Which was really unfortunate because there was a huge convention that day and the line was humungous. I had a hungry crew waiting on lunch, so I was sort of stressed out, but someone (owner I presume?) noticed and helped me promptly without making me wait in line.
author: Vianca N.

description: I have been coming here for lunch the past year and each time the food and service has gone down...Last time my Gyros had Little meat and all lettuce and wrap.at $12 its a Rip off..I Will Not be back..
author: Ken F.

description:
Haven't been to any of the other locations but this one suuuuuccks. 
Stopped by for some quick take-out Sunday evening on my way home. When I got home and looked in the bag I realized that instead of a gyro I got a wrap. Yes, they heard me and I ordered correctly. 
I was disappointed but still hungry so I gave it a go. The wrap itself was terrible. Halfway into it I finally reached the meat which was sparse, bland and room temperature. 
The fact that I paid $13 for this bag of sadness made the sting even worse. 
Judging by the incoherent snaggle-toothed kid that handed me my order on the way out I can clearly see that this place does not give sh*t. 
You've been warned.
author: Chris H.

description: Honestly they deserve 1 star but 2 stars for service.  Their wraps are 95% sauce and yogurt. I got the lamb gyro I'm lavash wrap and only middle has good amount of meat. Rest was just one small layer of meat and sauce. Hard to eat with sauce dripping. Way over priced for what you get. Not recommended.
author: Kourosh F.

description:
I'm giving this place 5 stars because it's fricken amazing!! 

Right when we walked in it felt like Ferry Buildings Farmers Market. There was fresh vegetables everywhere. Everything was so neatly organized and restocked. I felt like I was getting healthier by the second! 

The guy who took our order was nice. Did not rush us, but triple checked our order because my husband is a health nut so he wanted to make sure there was no sauce and the tahini on the side. I was the easy one. Just make it how it is and I'll be happy!! He even was nice enough to teach us how to pronounce shawarma. It was our first time there and we didn't want to butcher the name.

My husband ordered the chicken shawarma wrap. He said even though he had no sauce and the tahini on the side, the wrap was still excellent. The chicken was tender and juicy and all in all it had a lot of flavor. He liked how the wrap was full of ingredients. They were not skimpy one bit!

I had the falafel wrap. I loved how my wrap was filled with fresh lettuce with the falafels. The first two bites I didn't taste the falafels, but every bite after that there was a ton! I also had the curly fries! 

We would definitely come here again! There is no parking, but we parked at the Whole Foods parking lot and just walked.
author: Darlene M.

description:
Solid option for mediterranean food. 

They mezze plate is a good deal and the portion size is great. The dolmas are some of the better ones I've had in SF

If you live close by the delivery from here is prompt and the food arrives hot and fresh. 

The menu is a little limited but this place definitely hits the spot
author: Matthew B.

description: I got a chicken wrap , service was fast and nice and the wrap was in my opinion good and fresh. I would come back for more.
author: Simon B.

description:
Oh man I ate my food so fast. 2 Chicken Shawarma and 2 cokes. So amazing and the guys working here are really nice and polite. Normally I do not write reviews but my belly is so happy tonight. 

Definitely check this place out if you're hungry in San Francisco, great price for amazing food.
author: Nero D.

description:
A-OK Mediterranean food.

Oasis Grill offers your very typical Mediterranean dining experience.  Shawarma and Falafel are the staple dishes with multiple varieties and sizes to choose from.  Oasis also offers a variety of drinks from standard soft drinks to more Mediterranean choices. 

Service is a bit slow and food is a bit overprice.  But you will typically get enough food to make yourself full.

Not the best in Mediterranean, but Oasis will still meet your expectations for skewer cooked meats.
author: Nadav P.

description: I ordered a roughly $11.00 gryo wrap and it came out with one thin slice of meat.  I complained about the lack of meat and the lady told me it was because it was a special wrap.  I had one bite and left.  Total rip-off.
author: Randall T.

description:
Needed a quick bite and was feeling Mediterranean so decided to "take a chance" on this 3-star spot. WOW I don't think I've seen any other average star rating on Yelp be so far from reality. I got the falafel wrap and asked them to make it extra spicy. It was on "lavash" bread instead of the more common pita that other spots in the city often use and therefore was HUGE - bigger than 90% of the burritos you can find at any of the taquerias in the city. Inside it had just the right ratio of filling to sauce (tzatziki aka white sauce + hot sauce aka red sauce + hummus applied directly to the lavash). In addition to the falafel there was lettuce and lettuce plus some tomatoes and onions. I saw that they also had a vegetarian mezza platter with babaganoush which I absolutely love and asked for a side fully expecting them to charge me for it but they happily gave me a small container of it- note for next time to ask for it in the wrap while ordering.

I will definitely be back and will be exploring more of the menu. Only thing I wish was that they had beer because nothing beats a nice beer with some delicious food but other than that WOW. I just hope this will help their rating - it'd be a shame if other people missed this incredible spot because of some bad reviews.
author: Karan H.

description: Worst shawarma ever. expensive and its not that good. ugh so annoying. i been wanting to eat shawarma lol its hella dry too!
author: Lara J.

description:
Food was fine, but the customer service was shitty. Ordered a wrap and fries, and my fries never came.
I saw the person from the kitchen putting my fries on the counter, but the cashier didn't even paid attention. I finished my wrap like 10 minutes after the fries were standing on the counter and I decided to leave.
When I was leaving the cashier asked me "You still have fries, right?" Then I asked my money back for the fries. The guy didn't apologize and returned my money in a very rude way.
I'm never coming back again.
author: Israel L.

description:
Good: Clean and pleasant service
Bad: The food is below average.  I have only had the chicken shawarma: dry boiled chicken, bland sauce.  The portion size was good.
author: Martin B.

description: We made an online order because we had just a little time for lunch, but we ended getting our order 40 minutes late. The cashier was absolutely not helpful and didn't do anything to help. And finally the food was not even average for Mediterranean cuisine. That was my last time at this place and you should also pass your way.
author: David O.

description:
Now, I'm not anything close to being an Oasis Grill fan boy, on top of the fact that this isn't exactly a glamorous location, but I'm still kind of surprised by all of the mediocre reviews.  It's clearly not going to blow anyone away, but if you're in the area and have a serious hankering for some gyro wraps?  Not too shabby, friends.  Not too shabby!

A mini-chain of sorts, Oasis Grill has five different locations in the Bay Area, though they're mostly concentrated around downtown SF (there's one in Berkeley).  While this particular one has a relatively decent amount of seating, they're primarily a grab-and-go type of joint.  However, the food is better than just convenient, as it more than satisfied my cravings both times I've been here.

-- BEEF & LAMB GYRO WRAP and CURLY FRIES...$8.49 and $4.00, respectively
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oasis-grill-san-francisco-2?select=GmwXMMVzicuI_MxYSStQ6A)
On the one hand, this really hit the spot.  Not only were the veggies super fresh, but the cuts of lamb and beef were quite flavorful.  At the same time though, I wish it had more meat!  As for the fries, they tasted fine, but it's hard to say just how good they were since they were a bit soggy by the time we got back to my friend's place.

-- MIXED GRILL PLATE - Beef, Chicken, and Kefta (Ground Lamb) Skewers with sides, including Rice, Hummus, Cucumber & Yogurt Salad, Green Salad, and Bread...$16.99
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oasis-grill-san-francisco-2?select=ACXAkXxyrIzwOpFyPrvFag)
The price is somewhat hefty, but it's both filling and a great way to try several things.  All three meats were pretty good, but I liked the kefta the best - kind of like a lamb burger patty and not at all gamey.  As for the sides, some of them were actually pretty interesting, especially the rice (it tasted like buttery popcorn...).

Although Oasis Grill is a solid spot for a relatively quick bite, coming here should really be a result of already being in the area.   Street parking is at a relative premium and, while the 5th and Mission Garage is just a block away, this probably isn't/shouldn't be your ultimate destination that'd you be willing to pay by the hour for.  However, if you're already nearby?  Hey, you could do a lot worse.
author: Mike L.

description:
Yummy ! Food is light on my tummy. I like it ! :) I will be back ! 
I had a a chicken shawarma I recommend it. Good portions as well.
author: Vicky R.

description:
Food: The food is above average overall.
Rating: Three stars

Service: This is a walk-up counter scenario and the staff will bring the food to you after your order is ready.
Rating: Four stars

Atmosphere: The atmosphere is casual and functional.
Rating: Two stars

Location: The close proximity to Yerba Buena Gardens is convenient.
Rating: Three stars
author: K F.

description:
I needed something fast, easy and inexpensive for a late dinner after a long day. Oasis was near my hotel so I popped in for a chicken shawarma platter. I was followed into the business by someone I assumed was a customer but who ended up just being a random guy who wanted to chat me up. Ugh! I distanced myself and found it annoying that no one in the business seemed to notice or care that this happened. 

My friend was with me and she wanted a snack, so she ordered some stuffed grape leaves. I was surprised to see that they were pulled out of a large can. She told me today that the grape leaves were pretty mushy and I can't say that I was surprised. 

Fortunately for me, my platter was quite solid. I didn't like the baba ghanoush which was served instead of a green salad (which is what is stated on the menu), but everything else in the platter (rice, chicken, cucumber/yogurt salad) was good. 

San Francisco has tons of great food options, and I think I'd be more likely to seek one of those out over a second round at Oasis.
author: Michelle C.

description: Most delicious food made with the freshest ingredients!! My favorite is the vegetarian Mezza plate ("heaven" on a plate)!!!
author: Tesla S.

description: I am still surprised this place is still open given the mediocre food, poor customer service, and high price menu. I only stop by this place occasionally when I am tight on time and this is the closest and fastest option from my office. The annoying part is you will randomly be charged higher price than what is being adverized on the menu. Their excuse is they have not yet updated the board and will refuse to honor the price they are still advertizing to the public. It has happened to me three times out of five I have been there the last year and is absolutely unprofessional. I don't think I will visit this place again.
author: Ilhama A.

description: Really friendly chefs, it seems that many customers here are regulars and the chef remembers their usuals. Price about 10 dollars. The burrito is very saucy, but you can get a plate and a fork if needed.
author: Lisa O.

description: The gyros are not Greek. They are rolled tightly like a burrito, stuffed with red peppers, and contain a spicy sauce-all not proper per the Greek gyro encyclopedia. They are also $11 plus tax  I also ordered a ginger ale and was charged for a kamboucha, whatever that is.  Luckily, I looked at the receipt and was given the difference (but not the tax). Stay away. This place is weird.
author: Soy L.

description:
Come here if you like casual Mediterranean food at a reasonable price.

Order the chicken shawarma plate with Greek yogurt cucumber salad, hummus or baba ganoush, and rice.  They also add eggplant in the rice.  It was tasty.  Another option is chicken shawarma wrap.  If you like pita, it was hot and fresh from the oven.

The service was good as well.  We came in with a large group.  The staff rearranged the tables to accommodate our large group.  Towards the end of our meal, they gave our group Turkish delight on the house.      

I would come back if I'm in the area.
author: JM L.

description: This place has the BEST chicken shawarma I have ever had in a long time. The first time I had them with my family we all enjoyed the deliciousness. I went to Oasis Grill again a few days ago just for the chicken shawarma and got 5 to take home for my family. We all loved it. The people that were serving were really nice, and respectful. It's the only place I would go to eat when I'm in downtown. Knowing it's Halal just makes it easier to go and get a bite. Hope to come again, InshAllah. I'd recommend everybody to go and try their Shawarmas=)
author: Fatima 4.

description:
This is totally the restaurant to visit for lunch, due to its close proximity to the Moscone Center & Metreon. Their Beef & Lamb Gyro and Chicken Shawarma (including the plate version) are all very delicious.

I came in right after my workout session at the gym with the need to munch on a Gyro. Next moment, I found myself in here. I ordered the Beef & Lamb Gyro and munched away on it. This was certainly one delicious Gyro, I enjoyed it. Also, the portion of this Gyro is big enough to keep me filled until dinner.
The guys in the kitchen were very friendly and the lady doing the cashiering seemed very friendly. Overall, good experience here so I'll definitely be back. Oasis Grill - my favorite spot for Gyros and Shawarmas.

There are seats available to accommodate around 20-50 customers (I actually counted 42 seats). I thought this is a very good amount of seating for a restaurant in the South of Market area. As I have mentioned, it is close to several hotels, a theater and a convention center. Whether you work in a nearby building or just passing by, Oasis Grill is the restaurant to patronize. Especially when looking to satisfy your Mediterranean cuisine cravings.
author: Bennett W.

description: Good gyro, which is huge, very busy when there's a convention across the street. Nothing fancy but not bad.
author: Julio L.

description:
I like the Oasis Grill by work on Market, but I wanted to try a new location. Decided to stop by the 4th Street location for lunch on Wednesday, July 22nd around 1:30pm. I got take out which took about 10-15 mins to make.

*Mixed grill ($16.99): one skewer each of beef, chicken and kefta kebab plus sides - rice, hummus, cucumber & yogurt salad, green salad & bread
I'd been craving Mediterranean food for a while, so this was great! I love variety so having one skewer each of meat hit the spot. I didn't get a green salad (not sure if it actually comes with one, but it didn't come with my order) nor did I touch the rice or bread, but I finished everything else. I was definitely satisfied and maybe a little too full after eating this meal. It was delicious!

So why 3 stars? The location. I don't know why, but it seems a little dirtier than the one on Market by 3rd. I wouldn't want to eat here. Other than that, the food was still worthy of 4 stars. But next time, I'll just go back to the Oasis Grill by work.
author: Elena N.

description:
Crowded place but efficient 
Got the order quickly. Curly fries and lavash falafel wrap
Will be back when in the area
author: Pramee K.

description: I love this branch of Oasis grill. I sometimes came here when I was on this side of Lotta's fountain, and a rash of wrong orders sent me here for good from one of the other locations. I love this place. Rarely a deep line at lunch prime, I get my correct order, and the chicken avocado deluxe wrap is ridiculously good and filling. A+ for these good folks. I walk six blocks to get lunch from here and I do it often!
author: Patrick M.

description: the food is fine, not exceptional. The service is scattered and disheveled. It might be a rush or something but a better system is needed for staff! I waited way too long for a simple gyro....
author: Phoenix F.

description:
I grabbed a bite to eat here for dinner before heading into an event at the Moscone center. Didn't really pay attention to the atmosphere or any of that junk. I walked in, ordered at the counter. Waited for my food to be prepared. Then ate it. 

Oasis is a chain. They're all over. It's also like most Greek shops with falafels, gyros and dolmas. I got a shawarma wrap this time around. It was good. Very solid spot to get a Greek fix when you're in a pickle, but you will pay a little extra since it is SF. Not a top must visit since it's a chain. I'd rather save money at a small time place, outside of the city.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Greek on fleek! I came here with no real expectations. 3 stars can go either way, so I didn't have high or low expectations. There's like 3+ of these Oasises in the area FYI. Seems silly :)

Anyway. They were very quick. I got a chicken shawarma wrap - spicy. It was somewhat thin, but long (hold the jokes). Still very filling. I was pretty full halfway through, but continue to eat it over the next hour because it was tasty. Yes, I graze like a cow sometimes.

The spicy was perfect!! Went so well with the chicken and sauce. Next time I want to try the beef/lamb shawarma. Maybe even the deluxe....but lets not get too wild yet.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Came here on a whim with a coworker and ordered the chicken shawarma with spicy sauce and it came out awesome! The portion was big in my opinion, after chowing down one of these, you'll be solid for a good while. The spicy sauce is what really makes this shawarma awesome.

the staff here is friendly and the person who made the chicken shawarma was like an artist, drizzling the sauce like he's painting or something, haha.

This is a casual spot so plenty of seating and wasn't busy, normally not busy and they're open late, past 10pm. Overall I'll definitely come back here for some good shawarma.

*they also have a frequent buyer program, I think it's like buy 10 get 1? not sure...just know you can sign up for it.
author: Hao B.

description: This place is run by the same people as Ziggy's burgers but not as good. This joint focuses more on  Mediterranean food like gyros etc. I got chicken with rice that came in a tray with tzaziki, chili sauce, vegetables and baba ganoush. The food wasnt bad but the chicken lacked flavor. It seemed a little overpriced but the meat was halal so that is understandable. Not a bad place to go if you want fast food. Side-note: they use canola oil and can work with food allergies but have food with nuts.
author: Rida S.

description:
Solid shawarma, tabouli, and hot sauce that keep me coming back.

This fairly large lunch spot is a little further from most offices, which makes the lineup a little shorter during the regular rush.

One important exception: during conferences at the Moscone center, this location is usually overwhelmed by people with nametags hanging off their neck -- would be a good time to check out their Market st. location.
author: Artem A.

description: TERRIBLE. The food is ok but the place is run by whole bunch of lazy morons. We ordered 2 shawarmas which were ready 10 mins and they just let us wait there for 30 mins while the food were just laying there. No sorry or any remorse for what they did. DONT EVER COME
author: Tri T.

description: Generally the falafel lavash sandwich is really good but today they decided to short cuts and ruined it. They decided to use pita instead of lavash and didn't inform at the time of payment, then they serve the sandwich half cold and half hot... Why the hurry? Let the pita heat evenly at least.
author: Snigdha S.

description: Excellent beef shawarma. I had it 6 times during my week long conference. Chicken shawarma was not my favorite but ok. The grilled meat plate was good. Fries aren't that great, basic frozen shoestring that wont do much to brighten your meal. There tahini sauce is spot on, i asked for some extra on the side.
author: He M.

description: One of my favorite places to dine or order out. They have an amazing staff, great menu, and offer an exceptional experience. I love ordering from Oasis every time I'm in the city. Highly recommended!
author: Rami S.

description: Beautiful store on a corner with big windows. Unique offerings for sale by register like chocolate and baklava. Baklava was we priced and tasty and came in a beautiful to go container. Bottom was a touch soggy and sweet. Top crunchy and delicious.
author: Stefan T.

description: These guys have a process for huge crowds I gotta hand it to them every big conference I attend at Moscone Center I know I'm going to get a yummy chicken shawarma wrap!!
author: A R.

description:
Expensive for what you get. Dining room was dirty. I waited a long time to order, with staff ignoring me. I waited even longer for food... probably 20 minutes from the time I walked in. 

My $15 kefta plate had only one small skewer of meat. The rest of the plate was pretty good, but nothing special. There are way better places very close by: Grove, HRT, Tropisueno, Garaje, Dennys....

I will not go back. Dirty, slow, bad value for food that was just OK.
author: Adam R.

description: Convenient location, but below average food. The bread is very thin, and the flavor just doesn't do it for me.
author: Sean L.

description:
Yummy shawarma!
Yummy baklava!
...and a full selection of drinks and chocolates you'd normally see in Europe. 

This is my standard lunch place when I'm attending conferences at the Moscone. There's another location in the financial district that I'd frequent even though it was several blocks from my office. 

Shawarma - Fresh veggies and meats with spicy sauce all wrapped in a grilled soft wrap. 

Baklava - crispy flakes yet yet gooey from tons of honey

The ambiance leaves something to be desired. A jumble of chairs and tables. 

The prices are reasonable. $12 for a shawarma and drink. 

I'll definitely be returning.
author: David S.

description: I hardly ever give bad reviews but here it is. The hours for this restaurant say that they will be open at 10 on Sunday. We came a little before 11, and they still weren't open. We could see them inside and they said it would be 5 minutes. We took a walk and came back about 20 minutes later-they will weren't open. Someone was outside and said it would be another 20 minutes but we just ended up leaving. We were definitely excited for the food but didn't even eat there.
author: Amy E.

description: We were searching for a veggie meal and a kid friendly place for lunch. They have a friendly staff the place has room for seating. We ordered the Mezza plate and a grilled veggie sandwich. The grilled veggie sandwich was yummy. The mezza plate had a very small portion of tabbouli, grape leaf with rice, hummus, yogurt/cucumber sauce, small portion of salad and pita bread and about four falafels.  I didn't care for the mezza plate. The veggie sandwich was great.
author: Ruby O.

description:
I was craving for Super Duper during my lunch break and when I went inside, there was a long line. So I needed a second lunch option and so I saw Oasis. No line, woot.

I ordered gyro falafel wrap and specifically stated, mild or no spice at all into my order. When I opened it, I was already smelling the spice and was like... this is not good. So when I took my first bite, boom, it was spicy as fuck! Like, I specifically state mild or no spice and yet they gave me a wrap that was so spicy. So disappointment when you spend 9 dollars for a food that you specifically noted to them that little to no spice and yet they don't listen. 

The gyro was just okay. It could have been better. The spice overpowered the flavor or the dish itself. 

Not going to come back again.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I've always loved Mediterranean food. I've always seen this place. It's only been a few years. But I've finally tried it. Not bad I guess. My kebab wrap was pretty good. I inhaled it before going to my car. Falafels were pretty good as well.. I'ldd definitely come back for the other dishes.
author: John Z.

description:
Came here the day after my first visit and they forgot to put the hot sauce in my wrap. Which was basically what I had raved about in my original review!

Not sure if I'll be making the frequent visits that I thought I'd be making since now they're 2 for 2 on the messing up my order front.

...Unfortunately I'm kinda expecting something to go wrong again on my next visit.
author: Tina T.

description: This is located right across from the convention center. The meh reviews were a hint, but i was hungry, had just finished a convention, and wanted something close. I got the spicy shawarma and it was actually very good. The sauce has some distinct flavor and spice to it. Overall i think better than is given credit for.
author: Adam L.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by how great their wraps are! Walking into the place, it seemed like an average Mediterranean chain restaurant. My friend and I both ordered the falafel wrap, which was SO GOOD. The falafel was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside-- just how I like it. The tahini sauce was creamy, and complimented the wrap perfectly. Also, the wrap itself was perfectly sized-- not too big, not too small. If I'm ever in a rush and have a craving for Greek food, I'll definitely pay another trip to Oasis Grill.
author: Nicole A.

description: This place is delicious and fun.  Service is fast and pretty good.  Falafels are the best I've had in forever!  Good for vegetarians and carnivores.  Great selection of drinks and candy from Europe as well.  Went back 3 times in one week.  LOVE this place!!
author: R007s M.

description: Went to store at 9:30pm to try to buy something before a movie. Even though Oasis is not supposed to close at 10pm they were already closed. Ended up late to the movie as I had to find another restaurant. Lazy owners, will not be returning.
author: Teresa Z.

description: The tabouli chicken wrap was a good lunch and break refresher for me this Saturday after class. All the flavors of the tabouli, hummus, and the kalamata olives worked with the chicken kabob.   As for the wrap size, it is a good lunch size dish that won't make you sleepy when you return to class. Oasis Grill may be a recurring habit soon.
author: Marck N.

description: It appears they are everywhere.  It's very convenient to the Moscone convention center, but that's about it.  Got a beef/lamb gyro.  Nothing really special, when they say wrap, they aren't kidding.  I was expecting to have my gyro wrapped in pita bread, instead I got it wrapped in a tortilla.  Inside was the meat, some veggies, yogurt and chili.  Chili was a surprise, luckily it wasn't too spicy.
author: Kent H.

description:
I've eaten gyros here a few times and found them to be pretty tasty. The staff is great. 

Stopped in for a gyro tonight (delicious) and after I finished eating, I lingered a bit to read for a paper I have to write...as I sat there, they brought me another gyro (all wrapped up to take with me). They had no way of knowing it is was my birthday, but I thought that was pretty cool.  How awesome is it to order a gyro and then to be given an auxiliary gyro?  Pretty cool in my book. 

I recommend this place!
author: Wayne S.

description:
Against my better judgement, I came here because the spot was recommended by a number of people. 

NOTE: if you're thinking of going to Oasis Grill, don't go to this location, go to the others in the Financial

The food was about the quality of the ambience. It was about half a step up from Mcdonalds, and half a step down from Wendy's. 

We ordered: 
- Veggie Mediterranean Melt (spicy)
- Chicken Shawarma: Bland
- Chicken Shawarma platter 

All of it was 100% mild, and completely bland. I didn't even bother eating my whole lavash, despite being hungry.
author: Dimple B.

description:
The improvement since my last review is far away from then...

food **** cost $$ service ****.
GET IN LINE FOR THIS GYRO, FALAFEL AND SHAWARMA.
author: Andrew A.

description:
I passed this place, walked across the street, turned around and came back to it and didn't regret the backtrack one bit. I got the Chicken Mediterranean wrap to go which comes with grilled chicken, veggies and some kind of garlic sauce and it was really good. The wrap was huge so I only ate most of it. The chicken was good and tender and the garlic sauce added to the flavor. I like how the they grilled the whole wrap so that the tortilla is not super soft.

Overall, it was a good last minute meal, the portions are big and it has good flavor.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Average Mediterranean prepare to underwhelmed. Charged me 17$ for a falafel lavash, 2 baklava and a Coke. They didn't give me a receipt but I'm pretty sure they got my order wrong and charged me extra the falafel was a little less than 8$ which means I payed about 8-9$ for a Coke and 2 baklava I didn't even notice they had charged me that much until I went to a vending machine and my card got declined. Oh and they asked me if I want it spicy which doesn't mean any more than putting shitty grocery store hot sauce on the lavash. The falafel was broken on the inside. Cashier had pretty bad customer service skills looked very annoyed. So yeah don't go here I only went because it was across from my work but I won't ever go there again that is for sure.
author: Gabriel M.

description:
Pros:
1. The lamb shawarma (7/10) and tabouli (7.5/10) were tasty.
2. Timely service.

Cons:
1. Consistency of babaganoush felt a bit off.
2. Lot of gristle in the shawarma. The wrap was also a bit off balance - bites were either all veggies or all meat. 

Summary:
Oasis Grill was a fine stop for a quick bite, but not quite worth revisiting.
author: Robert M.

description:
I went here under the guise of pita filled goodness when I saw the words Gyro.
What I received was a lettuce filled tortilla with lamb and beef. Of course it was already pricey, but I was very disappointed.
author: Tegan R.

description:
I like this place just fine. 

Seems to be a chain of restaurants around the city, so they must do something right. Major pro: it's just down the street from my workplace, and they have a vegan falafel wrap that is pretty tasty. I really like that they label it "vegan" on the menu so I don't even need to specify what I need. 

I do think the service is a little bit slow (10-15 minutes for one wrap, especially when there are no other customers around, seems snail-paced), so I probably won't be stopping by here too often for my 30 minute break. Other than that, the customer service is friendly and the food hits the spot. 

I would recommend ordering one other side if you are super hungry. I've had the falafel wrap twice, and the first time it was quite large, but the second time it was a lot smaller, very skimpy on the fillings. When in doubt, Oasis Grill, bigger is always better. ;)
author: Brandi W.

description: I'm in town for a conference and decided to pop in. The place is very unorganized and I didn't get what I ordered. Instead of a couple kabobs and lavash on the side, I got 2 wraps and lavash on the side. The order was taken by the person I assume was an owner or management from my side of the counter on a piece of paper. When I told the guy at the register what I got, he charged me for whole plates instead of the two skewers I ordered. I didn't hear the price when I handed him my card (it was loud in there) and he couldn't figure out how to refund me. He instead gave me $10 cash. This ended up putting my skewers at $10 each. Not happy with the incorrect order nor being overcharged. I tried one of the wraps and  it was pretty good. I won't be coming back for the rest of my trip. I would have expected better organization for a restaurant so close to the event center.
author: Rob D.

description:
This is an awesome place to grab a bite. Fresh food prepared in front of you. If you are looking for Authentic Turkish/ Mediterranean food , then this is it! Their desserts like baklava and Turkish delights with rose, orange and pistachio will surely leave your taste buds in delight. 

We ordered minced lamb kebab and chicken shawarma and it was phenomenal. I am glad to have discovered this place in SF.
author: Jay K.

description: Came here today with a couple friends before seeing a movie. Never have been here before and I've read some mixed reviews on the place. I ordered the chicken shwarma plate and got a bottle of water. The food wasn't half bad. I'm not a fan of mushrooms though and there were quite a bit in the food. The hummus was good, the yogurt was good, but there was some kind of paste in the top right (seen in my picture) and it was super bad not to mention it smelled. My friend got the wrap and it looked way better! The place was clean and the lady was nice, but I just didn't order the right thing this time! Next time if I drop by I will definitely grab a wrap instead!
author: James R.

description:
Great food, quick service, value for money. 
Baklava is good.

Big portions so you won't go back hungry.

There's a public parking close by, otherwise finding a parking space on the roadside is very difficult.
author: Honey T.

description:
These ppl take advantage of drunk ppl- you purchase a $10 13 inch wrap and all you get a strip of gyro meat filled with salad and yogurt sauce. Ive posted a pic, hopefully you can see it see it but i would say 2.5 diameter the thin meat strip occupies less than 3% litterally. They know your druck so they'll but less meat and you wont mnow cuz all u wanna do is cram the thing in your mouth.

On a side note their wraps are descent if it had
More meat. 3/5 for wrap
author: Samim S.

description: Excellent freshly cooked lamb gyro. The sauce was a light explosion of taste, you can taste every single ingredient that was put together
author: Susan A.

description:
$11 for a mid sized shawarma wrap is honestly pricey! Also the place is freezing, I could use some heat to be warm at this time of the year. Tap water isn't offered. Menu isn't informant on drinks, chips and chocolates. I would expect a meal for $11. Most defiantly not coming back, first and last.


BTW offer more meat than cucumbers, plus who puts cucumbers on shawarma!!!
author: Ali S.

description:
I'm not sure why I had high expectations of this place. Perhaps it's so well-lit and on a prominent intersection, so I thought that their very survival was indicative of them doing something really well.

First off... I read somewhere that this place was cheap. I'm not so sure I'd call it cheap. Upwards of $15 for a gyro, fries, and a Coke isn't exactly inexpensive, when you think of what you can get for $20, elsewhere. The gyro meat was a bit dry, the pita was a bit stale, and the flavor just didn't really pop. The fries were fine, but standard, and there were no sauces offered to accompany them. The ($2.75) 20oz. bottle of soda was about as expensive as you can find outside of a ballgame or a movie theater.

Yeah, thanks but no thanks. With a few better options just a block or two north on Market Street, there's really no reason to come back here.
author: Sean B.

description:
In short: overpriced, meager portions, mediocre food, and bad service. 

I was given the wrong number when ordering such that I essentially had to reorder my food after waiting for a few minutes. Plates are very small for the cost. The kabobs were fatty, dry, underseasoned meats.  Cucumber and tomatoes looked like they were a month old. 

Unless this is your only option during a short break while attending a conference, steer clear.
author: Andrew R.

description: Best chicken shawarma in the bay, their falafel sandwich is kinda of good just need more sauce . But the shawarma is addicted.
author: Steve A.

description:
While looking for a quick lunch option close to the convention center, I spotted this spot. I'm a sucker for Mediterranean fare.

For a first timer, the menu can be a bit overwhelming. You can feel a bit of of pressure as your spot in line quickly approaches the cash register. 

I went for the vegetarian mezze platter since it meant I could try the most menu items. The portion is quite generous. It could be ordered to share, split into two meals or serve as a very filling lunch. I chose the latter route.

Though it wasn't the best I've had, the dishes were all very good. The atmosphere is nothing fancy and a little crowded, but it was clean enough.

I recommend this for anyone looking for a break from the catered food that comes with conventions. It's very close, so you don't have to worry about being late to your afternoon sessions.
author: Leigh W.

description:
Horrible gyros. It's not real gyros from a flaming meat spinner. No it's the cheap kind they buy packaged as slices then they throw on grill to heat and it was still cold tasting. 
I chose spicy but the untrained preparer put so much hot sauce it was on fire. Y don't u ask how spicy moron!
Overpriced for cheap meat that cost them 50 cents!
Need a real Greek place damn it
author: Marcus Y.

description:
- 20 minutes to prepare a falafel wrap and a mezza plate 
- Our order was incorrect
- The food is barely mediocre and obviously not fresh.  I'm amazed that Mediterranean food could be this bland.

How is this place even in business still?
author: Joshua C.

description: I've been wanting to check this place out because of the shwarma. The last time i ate was years ago back home. The shwarma at this place was good not exactly the way i ate before but it had good taste and it was spicy (which was good and they offer if you want it spicy or not) The server was helpful and nice and the service was fast. Will go back sometime
author: Aaron G.

description:
We were shopping in San Francisco. We walked by this restaurant and wanted to try it. Bought a shawarma and a falafel sandwich. Awesome food and as good as sandwiches back home. We will definitely be back. 
I wish they had their restaurant name on the white paper bags they gave us :). We sat at union square to eat the sandwices and a few people asked where we go them.
author: Z M.

description:
I ordered Uber eats from here and they were so rude to me. First of all, I ordered the hummus bowl and the picture showed simply 
hummus and pita bread. There was lamb in it and if I ate meat, I would be open to try it but i don't. I also paid more for extra pita bread and they gave me none at all. When I called them to clear things up, the woman on the phone tried to tell me there was pita bread in the bag........ Then she hung up on me!! It was so rude and unprofessional. They took my money
author: Vanessa P.

description:
A small corner restaurant with not so much seating area. HALAL.

We ordered our food and sat down. It's a bit pricey for the portions and the food in general. So right off, I wasn't impressed and was a bit let down. The food came and we picked it up and sat down. It was OK. I wouldn't say that it tasted great or "authentic" but it was cooked properly but was missing flavor. 

The hummus didn't taste like hummus but more of the "out of the can" flavor. 

Pricey and no real flavor...eat at your own risk!
author: Hina Q.

description:
Very disappointed with my 1st visit. Saturday evening and there were no other customers. It took 20 minutes to get a veggie plate and the order was still incorrect. 
Falafel was cold and not tasty at all. Hummus was OK. Everything else was not worth the $11 for the veggie plate. And the portions were paltry. 

I hope I caught them on a bad day. They seemed friendly.
author: Nina B.

description:
Two stars for awesome service, one star for delicious chicken. -1 star for high cost, -1 star for wood slivers in my salad.

Ok, grabbed a chicken kabob salad for lunch (15! Ouch), for the price I expected an amazing lunch, but it was just ok. The chicken kabob was really delicious with a lot of flavor and it tasted fresh. However as I was eating my salad I kept getting black wood slivers stuck into my gums (painful!), the slivers were from the kabob sticks.

*UPDATE: I have been up sick all night from the meal I had here, it's definitely food poisoning. Not so fresh I guess. I'll be getting my money back.
author: Miss M.

description:
So like there was this really groovy movie made back in '68 called "Wild in the Streets" where the youth of America took over Washington, D.C., and an underage rock star was elected President when they put LSD in the water supply. What a trip, man. What does this have to do with Oasis Grill, you may ask? Not much except the place appears to be managed by the same apathetic youth in the movie if you just flash forward the story 43 years. I assume this location, formerly the gawd-awful Jollibee's, is related to the original one on Drumm Street across from the Hyatt Regency on the Embarcadero. 

I like the original place, this one not so much. The cashier really seemed bothered that I wanted to order anything, but I persisted and asked for a $7.75 Kefta Kebab, a grilled lavash wrap with a combination of ground beef and lamb, lettuce, tomatoes, and doused with tahini sauce (see photo). What was tasty at the original location came out as dried-out and nearly inedible at this one. So disappointing that I couldn't finish it - which as anyone knows me, almost never happens. Jamie W. was similarly unimpressed, and neither of us were happy that the tables didn't look like they had been bussed all day. I wish I knew to bring my sponge and Formula 409. 

FOOD - 2 stars...a kebab that went kaboom 
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...anyone know where I can get a mop? 
SERVICE - 1.5 stars...some vocational guidance may be needed here 
TOTAL - 2 stars...think I'll need to haul my butt to Baladie if I want quality lavash wraps
author: Ed U.

description: Preface: came here on Labor Day for dinner given the slim pickin's open out there. They didn't have any fahtyre on hand when we went, darn. Falafel is kind of meh - it's not as flavorful as a lot of other places I've had; maybe it's their sauce as well? Also, their fattoush salad is a bit of a lie. Instead of the radish and red onions (among other ingredients) listed on the menu, they threw in olives, along with red and green bell peppers which appeared to be a part of one of the salad mixes in the bins. Worker said the radish was not in season and they didn't have red onion... Gonna skip this place in the future. :/
author: Linus W.

description:
This is the 2nd SF location of this Mediterranean food chain, it took over the corner that used to be Jollibee. Same standard menu: shawarma, gyros, falafel, hummus, etc.

The space is larger. But I like the original branch near Embarcadero Center better, because it has friendlier service.
author: Luis C.

description:
Excellent Food
Impeccable Service
Chill atmosphere
Check this place out if your in the area!
author: Wana A.

description:
3* Oasis Grill
200 4th 
San Francisco
Middle Eastern
Fast food, healthy
Tasty Chicken shawarma
Nice Greek salad
Order at counter; crowded at lunch time
author: Rosquete B.

description: Quality of the falafel wrap here is greatly improved. Wonderfully made. Perfect heat.
author: Keane L.

description:
Great gyro and falafel.  Had been traveling all day and needed a quick bite.  Service was quick, fast, and polite.  
Food was hot, fresh, and lots of flavor.  Ended up going back two more times while visiting buds in SF.
author: C. C.

description: Everything is made from scratch here. Thoroughly enjoyed the beef shawarma. Super delicious and fast. Great for gluten free, and they were super helpful verifying ingredients for another allergy.
author: S D.

description: Awesome falafel wrap. Tried the beef and lamb wrap with their hot sauce, so good. Their Greek salad was missing olives -1.
author: Chris C.

description: Quick and easy and great food. The fatoush salad with falafel and hummus substituted for chicken is a great and filling veggie option. Also enjoyed the eggplant and pomegranate wrap.
author: Nikolais L.

description:
Gyro wrap was not bad, filling and pretty tasty. Would probably get it without the spicy sauce next time. 

Went around 2pm and there was no line, but I imagine it gets extremely busy during lunch hours.
author: Stephanie Z.

description: Never disappoints.  While not the absolute best Mediterranean food I have had it is always solid and consistent. I always ask for extra spicy and they don't hold back on it.  The Shawarma is my favorite and have had a few of the plates on occasion. Perfect to go or to eat in!
author: Chris G.

description: Good food. Unfriendly service and dirty tables (we had to clean our own while the workers behind the counter did nothing).
author: Randy F.

description: Disgusting. Ordered the spicy Shawarma, and as a world traveler, this was hands down the worst.  Never again
author: Edwin G.

description:
Atmosphere and service : C-
Food : B+ 

We came here for dinner a few nights ago. The restaurant was empty aside from our party, and the door was wide open in 40 degree weather. When my mother in law asked them to close it while we ate ... He had to check with the kitchen. They did close the door eventually, but I found it off putting that the comfort of dine in customers was less important than that of the staff in the kitchen. 

The food was excellent! i got the beef shwarma plate, and it was fresh, hot, well portioned, and delicious. Be sure to try the Harissa hot sauce with your meal. It's excellent! I also loved the Baklava. Great recipe. 

I would recommend this spot for a quick lunch, not a sit down dinner.
author: Katie G.

description: This place sucks Royally!! There veggie plate is $11.00 & it's not even organic veggies. Over price junk franchise, not really good quality food. Same garbage that's over priced.
author: Repent Seek Salvation Y.

description:
Got so distraught as we were eating and some crazy man came in and started digging in the restaurant trash bin. nobody from the staff noticed...and he started yelling at our table because the table was stationed by an exit door. So crazy man, got mad at us diners. 

One of my friends had to get up to get one of the server's attention.
So yah. that's kinda crazy. 

As for food though... pretty slammed with meat.My boyfriend and I ordered a chicken and beef shawarma.. The tzatziki sauce was yummy... The beef though was more tasty than the chicken. It wasn't extraordinary..and it wasn't bad. It was decent. 

For this restaurant to take over the old Jollibee? hmmm... i wish they kept Jollibee.
author: Monica H.

description:
I ordered a beef and lamb gyro and what I received was a cold, soggy, pile of poopoo. But seriously, it took like 25 minutes to get my food and it wasn't even the lunch rush yet. By the time I got my food it was cold, the pita bread was soaked through because of the mess of tzatziki sauce they put in there, and the "beef and lamb" they put it in it tasted like a hamburger patty.

Possibly the worst gyro I've ever had.
author: Angelo D.

description: I was craving a lamb gyro for lunch and thankfully, Oasis Grill was a 2 min walk from me.  When I walked in, I was surprised to see it was pretty dead since it was lunch hour.  The girl who took my order seemed very negligent, she just hands me the cc receipt to sign without saying anything and walks off to make food.  So I just signed the receipt and left it out on the counter.   Even though there were only 4 or 5 people my gyro took about 10 mins, and she forgets my hot sauce.  I couldn't finish my food not because I was too full, but because it was bad.  The gyro was bland even after I poured two containers of hot sauce.  The lamb which was nonexistent, was dry.  I felt like I just paid $8+ for plain lettuce and tomatoes.
author: Erica C.

description: The gyros aren't that great. The meat is dry and the service is slow. They only survive because it's right next to the Moscone Center so they get a huge rush during lunch hours whenever there is a convention in town.
author: Binh D.

description:
food is ok 
shawarma was cooked on grill 
doesn't taste like the one that  is cooked on shawarma grill
and also the seasoning  sucks
beef shawarma tastes like Korean beef
author: Carla L.

description:
FOOD POISONING is the experience my friend and I had at the 4th st Oasis Grill.
We BOTH ordered the (expensive) beef Shawarma and BOTH got sick 12hrs after that w similar symptoms, the ones you get when you eat sh*t.
This place needs to be inspected asap.
author: Eolus C.

description: Had the Kefta Kebab platter. Was OK, but problem was about an hour later got stomach ache and needed a trip to the bathroom...
author: Tinou B.

description:
Good promise but soggy and too much spice to taste the meat. Given the manual ordering a lot of mistakes for large group of people. 

Salad looked best of all.
author: Leo U.

description:
Is this Oasis Grill owned by the same people as the Oasis Grill on Drumm?  If so, they should enhance their training program because this location's food does not stand up to the food at the Drumm location.  If not, whomever is making the food at this restaurant should go over there to see how it's done right.  

I work around the corner, and was excited when I saw that there was an Oasis Grill near by.  I used to frequent the location on Drumm street all of the time before my office moved, and it was amazing.  Anyway, I ordered a Chicken Schawarma Wrap.  At under $9, it's a pretty good option for lunch in the area.  Also, they give you a pretty big portion.  The flavor was nice, but there was way too much sauce in the wrap.  I think that a wrap should be able to be consumed without using a plate, or 75 napkins, but the minute you bite into this wrap, the sauce gushes all over the place and the wrap starts falling apart.  I'm not a chef, but if you lighten up on the sauce a bit, the thing might stay together, be less messy, and taste better.  

I would go back to give it a second shot just because the flavors were OK, but if I get another sauce bomb, I'm donezo.
author: Nick T.

description:
The one star is only because the food is tasty. Negative 10 stars for "Rebecca" that is apparently the manager at this location. Here's the conversation between us:

"I'd like a chicken shawarma please. Can I get it in a bowl please? I don't want the wrap"

"We have the platter for $12.99"

"No, I want to shawarma, which is $8.49. But the contents in a plastic bowl"

"Okay but you will be charged the platter rate"

"What? You want five bucks to not do work?"

"Yes, it's the laying out of the contents in a platter that costs money"

"What if I was gluten intolerant or allergic to the wrap?"

... Blank stare. Then "then you'd have to pay for the platter"

Owners of Oasis Grill, if you're reading this, please don't hire people like this at your two new locations. Please please please. Hire someone who can use the brain that nature has provided us.
author: Kunjal R.

description:
Good quick place to eat. Efficient services and great shawarma.

They take your order as you stand in line. Really a good system when it's crowded.
author: Kyler K.

description: Food is nothing short of fantastic. Friendly staff. If I lived in San Francisco or stayed longer, I'd come here again!
author: John A.

description: After passing this place so many times while walking along 4th, it was about time we tried this place. Walked over on Thursday night and it wasn't very busy at all. I tried the falafel wrap since you've gotta have some good falafel's in a Mediterranean place right? It was ok - not great, not horrible. The wrap was filled with cucumbers - which I hate, so that made it a little hard to eat, I had to dig out the falafel to give it a fair try. The menu didn't show a list of ingredients so I guess thats my bad for not knowing what would be in there. I also had a side of hummus which was just ok as well...
author: Leina K.

description: Food was just plain okay, didn't particularly taste like Mediterranean food. A Chicken Shawarma for less than $10 though, guess you can't complain about the prices.
author: G G.

description:
I Love SF!  All the great, diverse culinary choices open late and just a stroll away has my heart!

Ordered: 
Gyro plate - The gyro meat was seasoned to perfection, the wrap was a nice thickness and texture.  This gyro has me thinking of the cart in NYC that ruined my gyro experience anywhere else.  This gyro however brought back all the great memories of what a gyro should taste like!

Come here if you're anywhere nearby!  It's that good!
author: Matthew M.

description:
Yikes, how can a chain have such a broad quality spectrum? The Oasis Grill on Drumm street is MUCH better. This one, MEH.

For one, the fries are soggy! Gross.

I came here twice. The first time I got the lamb & beef gyros it was pretty good. I thoroughly enjoyed it. It's about $9, which is the norm. But the fries I got were really bad. I got them to go, and I'm not sure if that was the cause for them being soggy, but I ate them within 45 minutes. And if fries get soggy that soon, that's not ok!

The second time I steered clear of the fries and got the gyros again. And oh my was the gyros terrible! It was bland, the meat was burned, and it as like eating a lettuce wrap with no flavor. I asked for it spicy and I tasted no spice. Absolutely disappointing.

That's something that is unforgiving. There are other Oasis Grill's around that are far better quality!
author: Junel S.

description: Oasis Grill is pretty great. I just had it for lunch today! It's one of my favorite lunch spots near my work or near Union Square. The food is pretty good here, but my absolute favorite thing to get here is the Veggie Mezze Plate. I am obsessed with their falafels and the selection of mezze. All the mezze items are fresh and tasty. I love taking little chunks of the falafels and little spreads of all the mezze on a piece of pita, and stuffing it all together in my mouth, and I feel so comforted. And even when I take it home, and everything isn't at fresh, it still tastes so good. LOVE this plate. I know a lot people like the shawarma here, but I cannot live without the veggie mezze plate. I just hate that is is so close to Moscone. And so when conferences happen, I can't eat there or I have to wait in such a long line!
author: April D.

description: Best Mediterranean food I have had in a long time! Shawarma was juicy and all the veggies were as fresh as it gets. Most of the places I go use pita for the wrap but the wrapped in a lavash was awesome!
author: Richard R.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1027.

More of 3.5 stars.

The Mediterranean place replaced the old Filipino fast food joint. It most likely will do better since it's more main stream.

The place has a decent selection of food and although I didn't see the rotisserie spit, it might be somewhere back there.

I opted for the Shashlik (beef cubes on skewer) on platter. They grill by order and the meat was okay marinated but was slightly undercooked. It also looked like the eatery is big on vegetables since it came with a big side of precisely cut cucumber with tomatoes (kind of like Tabouli), very finely chopped parsley (salad style), cucumber with yogurt a full bed of tomatoes, lettuce and zucchini. It also came with Tahini hummus sauce (very good) and lavash bread.

As paying I saw they also carry baklava. It was quite tasty.

Overall the kitchen has an impeccably clean feel with bright lights and some Mediterranean tiles.

Excellent service with some chuckle sense of humor made this place more friendly and enjoyable.
author: T L.

description:
Vomit wrapped in vinegar sauce... 
I guess the food is at least a match for the bitchy girl at the register who explained it as "it's like... Meat... We cut it.." 
First time in years and years I couldn't finish food I had purchased - wouldn't wish this wretched crap on an enemy.
All that topped off with craptacular service - it's a recipe for something - just nothing you want.
author: Shaun B.

description:
Not that good. We dropped in only because it was close to our hotel and we were walking buy and wanted a snack.  The shawarma was NOT good.  It lacked flavor and the rest of the meal was also bland.  The saving grace, surprisingly, were the onion rings!  The onion rings were amazingly flavorful and nicely breaded!  

And, oh, they do have Orangina.
author: Alice T.

description: Why the hate for this location, I was expecting a higher rating. I love Oasis Grill after trying out their location in San Leandro. The food here was pretty good too, can't go with the Gyro (yeero).
author: Sunil R.

description: Good flavors and selection, the experience was kind of ruined by the fact that my food to a very long time to come out, however it was yummy none the less. It was kind of pricy however it was Downtown SF.
author: Gabriel D.

description:
Located near the Metereon in downtown SF, Oasis Grill offers a great Mediterranean option for your movie or shopping experience.  I came here to grab a quick bite on the go before watching a movie.  We ordered two chicken shawarmas and I was quite pleased.  They were fresh, toasted lightly, and the spicy sauce was delicious but not too hot or overpowering.  For $8, it was a great on the go choice as well as made others in the movie theater jealous compared to their overpriced hot dogs and candy.

For the time-crunch, ease of purchase, and flavor, I would recommend this place if you are downtown.
author: Robert T.

description: Excellent shawarma, all configurations.  Gets crazy crowded and disorganized during lunch rush, so get there early.
author: Tim S.

description:
For being the restaurant directly across the street from the Moscone Center, I expected much better from Oasis Grill. In the end, it was just OK. Nothing outstanding, no amazing burst of flavor from my chicken schwarma wrap. Your standard thin flat flour wrap, standard large-ish size, very standard chicken pieces. A lot of yogurt sauce and lettuce inside. I ordered mine spicy, and got no spicy sauce at all inside the wrap, and no spicy sauce offered with it when I went to pick up the order - disappointing, despite the Game Developers Conference lunch rush in the restaurant that day.

They also have international candy bars lining the counter all the way from the beginning of the line to the register to lure you in; the prices are not indicated anywhere around these bars. The line gets long, almost out the door, and it gets crowded and noisy at lunch with conventions going on.

In the end, I only ate half of the wrap and didn't feel compelled to eat the rest. I've had much, much better from many other Mediterranean places. It just lacked good strong flavors overall. For how much business they get from the convention center being across the street, I believe they've probably gotten lazy about their food because they can get away with it due to their location. And that's too bad.  I would only eat here out of necessity, not out of choice.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Clean place, yummy platter, prices aren't too high like other places, nice area &  cool crowds. Also they've Middle Eastern goodies!
author: R C.

description: Close to convention center. Moderate wait. Medium prices. Chicken shawarma was very tasty. Another day tried the kibbe plate. Tasty, but long wait.
author: Lynne B.

description: Pretty good Mediterranean food. I like the lunch combos, pretty good deal and good sides. Very convenient if you are in the Moscone Convention Center, it's right across the street.
author: Peter K.

description:
Went to get some food for the family. I got the chicken shwarma and it was great. I loved it. But my brother and my parents got some kebab food and it wasn't as great. I'd say stick to the shwarma here. Decent amount of food too. 
P.s - get it spicy. Makes it a lot better.
author: Eun Taek L.

description:
In need of a quick lunch while attending a conference at Moscone West, I happened on Oasis Grill with a coworker. We were told to get the chicken shawarma - "the best thing we have on the menu" - so we ordered it with medium spice. Note: if you like heat, go for the full on spice. Medium didn't cut it. 

My sandwich was okay, pricey for what you get, but at least I didn't have any gristle in my wrap. My coworker wasn't so lucky. After a few bites, she couldn't eat any more. So we went over to Starbucks to get coffee and for her, a warm piece of pumpkin bread.

Bottom line: Oasis Grill will do in a pinch, especially if you get your order to go. The restaurant is small, and the tables apparently do not get cleaned between diners. But if you have time, you're better off at one of the joints off Market Street.
author: Maria S.

description:
I would not even give it one star. The Worst Falafel I Have Ever Tasted! They asked me
if I wanted it hot as in spicy I said yes. There was nothing that was even remote that tasted hot. No harissa sauce nothing at all. Serving it hot was obvious, it wasn't even that, old dry yet greasy tasting falafel 3 small croquettes, some kind of mayo/yogurt, diced tomato and cucumber on a stale and hard lavosh. Total shit. This is the first time I ever expressed myself to an owner's face about how spectacularly bad a meal could be.
I think the majority of their trade are conventioneers who they will never see again. I would rather eat a subway 5 Dollar Footlong than that slop.

AVOID AT ALL COST!!!! GO TO MCDONALD'S INSTEAD
author: .James A.

description: Great food! On my first visit I if the lamb/beef gyro and came back for the falafel wrap. Both were delicious. They are also very good at handling a crowd.
author: Sarah W.

description:
After attending a conference at Moscone, we were ready for some lunch. Something quick and inexpensive. Most places around Moscone tend to be overpriced so having seen this place on numerous occasions, we give it a go. 

Getting to the restaurant, we stand in line to order from the large menu on the board. They have the usual schwermas and other Mediterranean foods but schwermas are what we want. I get the gyro but this isn't the usual gyro with a pocket pita filled with meat but it's more of a wrap. Not what I was expecting. 

The gyro wrap is a bit dry and crisp. Fortunately, the interior is filled with moist meat and veges dripping with tahini sauce. Flavor-wise, nothing remarkable to report. I've had better schwerma with a smokier flavor from the meat, more meat, better tasting special sauce inside and of course superior tasting hot sauce that's more tart, spicier.

Basically, it's pricey for the quality but it's convenient if you're in the area for a conference.
author: Norman S.

description: Had a great experience my first time dining here. The staff is friendly and knowledgable about their menu items. The prices are reasonable, the portions are very large (I did not finish) and the chicken shawarma wrap I had was delicious. My only complaint is that they asked if I wanted it spicy, I said yes, but it was not spicy at all. Maybe this is just a personal preference of "spice factor", but overall I would definitely go back and would also recommend to others! Note: There is another location very close by to this one in the Financial District. That one is larger and has more seating.
author: Sara D.

description:
The only 'Oasis' here is the code-entry bathroom where I can find a moment's shelter from every chemically imbalanced whackjob in SoMA. 

Amazing roll-ups though; almost as good as the ones grand-mère used to make in Alajtoun, Keserwan, Mount Lebanon (24 km north of Beirut).
author: O. Reli-yah S.

description:
Great chicken shawarmas here!
i absolutely love the food here and especially the location

Also the white guy their is cute ;)
author: Tamia L.

description: Second time here. Love it. Falafel wrap last time. Chicken Shawarma plate tonight. Consistently delicious. Great staff. I'll be back
author: George E G.

description:
$3.49 for 1L bottle of water? So turned off by this place. This water better blow my mind! This was my thought as I sat and waited for my food.

Stopped by, not by choice, but because my travel buddy needed food ASAP. I had the veggie plate and I might as well had plaster. I just couldn't find a source of flavor. I've tasted better hummus from a grocery store.

I was just bothered at the audacity of charging $3.50 for water. I know it's in front of a major conference center and many unsuspecting out of towners, but that's just trashy.
author: Keesy S.

description: Flies everywhere, dirty tables and floors, food was extremely overpriced; not coming back.
author: Mrs I.

description: Nothing spectacular about this place. I ordered a Gyro for my boyfriend and they used pre-frozen boxed meat, not the real thing on the spit. Also the bread is just pre-packaged, not fresh. We've had much better. Also not a good value for $9.26.
author: Sonya S.

description: They ignored me when I walked in, and the food was average (at best) quality. Not going here again. :(
author: Tim R.

description:
Drove here, Just to eat here all the way from Daly City.
I have already found a great place where they make badass shawarma and kebabs-good frickin chicken in Mission-but decided to explore and came here.
the service is nice(the girl cashier was very sweet) and a place seemed clean. the fridge is filled with good choice of drinks and I was so excited to try my Kefta wrap-disappointment.
It totally lacked flavor. Hummus and the cucumber salad has totally dominated, and the kefta had disappeared in all that mixture. 
So sad :( really wanted to love this place, as I pass by it a lot.
author: jamila u.

description: Not real shawarma. Ordered beef shawarma but it was ground beef. Pita bread wasnt real Pita either.
author: Mohammed D.

description: I was staying at the Marriot which is on 4th St. also and stumbled across this place while on the search for food.  This is a great place to grab some mediterranean food in the area.  The seating was spacious here and a bit dead when I came in (though it was around 5 pm on a Friday).  I got the chicken schwarma plate which came with 3 sides.  It was plenty of food for a starving person.  I also go the baklava which was a bit sweet for my taste, but still delicious.  It was a bit on the expensive side but that is expected from the Financial District area.
author: Richard L.

description: Great flavors,excellently prepared food and good service. I have had most everything on their menu and not been disappointed.
author: Gerard C.

description: I would love to give them 4-stars but I am little disappointed that the lady at the counter does not show enthusiasm (-1) at work and provide little or no help when I asked question. Overall, the meal is good and good level of spices to make it tasty and not very blend but I am not a fan of eating out from bento box in the restaurant (-1). I think it is good for take away but not when I am in the restaurant. I like to have my meal on a plate and plastic is fine but not from a box. We like the spicy sauce on the side and the bread is warm and soft. (1). All the meats are Halal (1) and they have plenty of table inside (1). Parking is very difficult to find here for dinner.
author: Sam M.

description:
I'm always searching for Halal Food in the financial district of San Francisco. I wanted to give Oasis a 4, but I just couldn't bring myself to do it. Don't get me wrong, this place has decent food, but It's not mind blowing or anything. I've tried the Falafel and at times it's been delicious and then other times I've found the Falafel wrap to be a bit dry. The Chicken Shawarma is fairly tasty and filling as well. I have to say that I'm a bit spoiled when it comes to Shawarmas and things like this because I've lived in Southeast Asia and enjoyed small Indian and Middle Eastern shops that were very authentic and tasty. I was searching for this back home and I guess my standards are quite high. 

Overall the food is good though and if you're hungry and not as much of a Shawarma snob as me then you may be inclined to give it 4 or 5 stars.
author: Rich T.

description:
Same old story.

Similar to the other location: http://goo.gl/Yyg3T

Food was once again good.

Veggie wrap was the perfect blend of red peppers, zucchini, tomato, lettuce, onions and spices inside a toasted lavash. Hummus swapped for tahini no problem. Delicious.

(includes cheese and mushrooms for those who want it)

(kebab burger that was on their launch menu is unfortunately nowhere to be found)

Service was once again good.

Felt my requests were heard and special attention given to make sure they happened 

Price was once again too high. Charged eight with tax. Worth six.

More good than bad earns them three. Could be so much more with a better balance of quality/price.
author: Jason B.

description:
I came in and got the beef shishlick plate and fried sweet potatoes.  Sweet potatoes came quick, liking this, until 15 minutes later when I'm still waiting for my plate order.  

I was being cool and asked what's going on.  Turns out something went wrong in the kitchen.  One of the lady who was getting orders murmured something and the other explained I was there even before all the people came.  Yeah, know-it-all-lady, I was waiting for a long time.  

I was asked if I wanted something else so I didn't have to wait longer.  I said I'll get the chicken instead.  Now, this was $1 cheaper but nobody mentions about giving me the difference back.  I was starting to get annoyed, I was super hungry so I opted not to make a big fuss.
