What happened is not cool at all.  Good thing I'm always slow to anger and the nice lady who initially took my order was nice.  Food tastes great - I give them that!
author: Pam S.

description: Why does this only have an average of 3 stars? Perhaps everyone else is ordering wrong. Here's what you do: Order the falafel. (It comes wrapped in lavash.) They ask if you want spicy sauce. Say you want *some* spicy sauce. Pay ~$8. Consume deliciousness.
author: Shannon R.

description: This place is pretty good. Word of advise - if there is a conference going on at the moscone center it would be best to order your food over the phone and then pick it up. The restaurant gets crowded with long lines.
author: Paul S.

description: I came here for lunch in a rush, needing to grab my food and go. Though parking was a pain (we ended up parking at the Moscone Center), I was pleased by how quick the service was. I ordered a chicken schwarma, and my food was ready within 5 minutes. When I finally sat down to eat it, the chicken was really tender, the sauce was zesty, and the wrap nicely rolled so that I didn't make too much of a mess. My only issue is that all the sauce seemed to have concentrated at one end of the schwarma, so the flavor was lacking throughout in comparison. However, great place to come for a quick fix and tasty schwarmas at a great price.
author: Hurnan V.

description:
Just because you have a endless supply of clueless out of town visitors passing your door  every day does not mean you should offer so so food and uninterested service. The prime location across from Moscone Center has allowed the service and food quality to be sub par. It's too bad  because this cuisine is fairly easy to do and really tasty when done right. Everything costs $ 9-12 ( that's about 4 more than other mid east places) and it's essentially a take out  joint.
The girls working there must be sedated , you know that distant stare and your order comes out without the hot sauce you requested, plus they don't even offer you a drink? That's what greeted us, even before the lunch rush on a Wednesday.
The food was slim ( as in small portions) even the server could not tell the falafel wrap from the lamb. The wraps are thick with carb laden lavosh bread and thin with fillings.
The real crime is the old and soggy baklava. Fresh baklava is a sublime experience, with crispy filo & layers of nuts, honey and pure yumminess. Avoid their impotent soggy bottom triangles, It's an insult to good pastries everywhere.
These guys should to step it up a lot, but with all the visitors walking by who will never return, there is no real incentive. There are way too many good options within  200 yards of Moscone to waste your lunch money here.
author: Aaron Z.

description: Yuck, the gyros taste plain and bland.  The tomatoes are those typical cardboard variety, and the chicken takes like it has been sitting out in peanut hummas overnight.   Maybe I am spoiled by going to Ayola, which is nearby, and more much authentic.   There really is no comparison. Oasis charges the typical $10 for a gyro, but the quality is not worth the price tag.  The fries are also soggy.
author: Jackson W.

description: One of the best Gyros I have ever had! I came here for lunch during a Trade show since it is across the street from the Moscone Center. The prices were in line with the portion sizes so make sure you go with an appetite.
author: Justin F.

description: This place is newly open so when I order I don't know what is in what so I asked what is the dish, she just yelled back A or B ?! I asked again what is in the dish she yelled again A or B?! I have to guess what she means then reluctantly ordered. Come out with very little meat in a bento box. $15? Not worth it. Nothing is specially good. Probably would close out in couple month. I want to shout back! Don't go there!
author: Shin T.

description:
Since I eat at the Oasis in Hayward weekly, imagine my delight when I saw they were opening a location mere blocks from my house!  

I ordered my usual chicken shawarma wrap extra spicy. Hubby got the chicken something platter which came with 2-3 salads and tons of rice.  Of course I got a piece of the world's best baklava.

The young lady working the counter was fantastic. Very knowledgeable about the difference between the chicken shawarma and the other chicken which I can't recall the name. She kept those boys hustling in the kitchen.

Food didn't disappoint! Everything was tasty, juicy and spicy. One star off because things cost $2 more per item than in Hayward.
author: Kim W.

description: This place is really close to my work and I seem to have a craving for Mediterranean food/ wraps every other day so I figured I would check it out with my co worker. It's a little overpriced at almost $10 for a chicken schwarma wrap cause the chicken is on the dry side and there are so many other lunch places around but they are VERY quick and their spicy sauce is really good!
author: Clarice C.

description: When at a conference at Moscone center, you must exit the facility, avoid their crappy food and go eat here. It is right across the street from the center. Yes, there will likely be a line out the door, but it is worth it. Delicious falafel wraps and MiddleEastern simple foods. Lunch will be under $10 and you can get a few minutes of fresh air.
author: David P.

description: Order it spicy...  I came here three times on my week long business trip.  I loved it.  First visit I had a Chicken Shawarma Platter (with humus, cucumber yogurt, and Tabouli).  It was fantastic.  Next stop, I had a Gyro which was made with humus and garlic yogurt and I ordered a side Greek Salad.  Once again, it was very good.  Third visit they were closed :-(  It was after 11PM and the open sign was lit but the doors were locked.  I wish we had food like this in Central IL.
author: Mike N.

description: Vegan friendly with falafel and the veggie melt (hold the cheese) and both are under $10. The place itself is small and extremely casual... I wouldn't recommend eating there unless you're in a rush.
author: Marie C.

description: Came here once.  I was hungry and left full.  And went again on the way home on new year's for a drunken night's sober food fest.  And even then was left feeling like I could have eaten some fried goodness to satisfy late night hunger binge.  Don't get me wrong- the food isn't bad; it just lacks the flavor expected.  Fresh veggies though but that's not what I'm looking for ..I'm eyeing and wanting delish meat that I did not find here.
author: Kimberly C.

description: I love this place for its quick service and great value. The chicken shawarma rolls with the spicy sauce, hummus and salad is a great combination and I've not had to wait more than 5 minutes during some of its busiest hours.
author: Harish D.

description:
I love the first oasis grill on drum street but this one needs to get it's act together. The food tastes just as good but this location is just having some serious problems. It really needs to filter through it's hires better for one. Total "meh" don't care attitude with everyone. They don't understand what they are serving, how to wrap it, or to include a napkin.  

I came the day they opened. It was khoas, but i figured that they would get up and going soon and be as good as the other one soon enough. The staff all seemed confused and unsure about everything though.

Today I came in and they had rap music on so loud it, I couldn't think. I ordered a chicken shawrma wrap. The guy wrapped it like and idiot and 30 seconds out the door I had hotsauce/taziki sauce down my leg. The guy couldn't  figure it out and twisted the bottom up then bent it. Complete fail. For a $9 wrap it's not worth it. 

I won't eat at this location again until they retrain their staff or fire the people up front.
author: Zac B.

description:
Decent felafel wraps, but i wouldn't recommend this place.
Quality can be questionable as they've once served me unfroozen raw fresh-fries.
A bit over priced too.
author: Ayall S.

description: Pretty crappy falafel wrap. The sauce was way too liquidy and not hot as requested. I ate it because I had just had a really long flight and was starved but didn't want a full meal, but definitely wouldn't stop by again.
author: Rowena L.

description: Their location in Hayward is one of my wife's favorite restaurants so she was really happy when they opened a location near us.  We had to go check it out shortly after they opened and have been back a few times.  Both of us really enjoy the chicken platters that come with chicken, rice, hummus, babaganoush, a couple of salads, and some hot sauce.  It was very good and we'll definitely be back.  The only downside is that the food isn't exactly cheap and I understand their location in Hayward is a few bucks cheaper, which is understandable.  One other thing I wish they had is some outdoor seating which would be nice, especially on a nice sunny day.
author: Scott L.

description: Get the Mix Grill with an extra side of red sauce; add a chicken skewer and the meal is good for two people to share the lot
author: Ryan S.

description: Great little quick, middle eastern food. Had the falafel wrap. It was so good but could only eat half as it was pretty large for lunch. A bit cramped dining area but decent views of the hustle & bustle around the hotels & Moscone Center.
author: Simone W.

description:
As I keep trying the menu I get to be a happier camper. The food is delicious and healthy. It is light and filling. Thank goodness there is some good Mediterranean food near work. 
The music is fine now, they pay attention to consumers input. I have never eaten it, I just grab the food and go. Yet I look at the seating and all the painting they have done to  spruce the place up and its appreciated. So not the Fast food join that they took over. 
Not that they are slow, heck usually they are pretty quick and friendly. Start at the end and work your way to the cashier. Depending on what you order its gets specially cooked.
author: Natasha M.

description:
Mediocre and tasteless chicken schwarma, mealy tomatoes, no dressing on wilted Greek salad.  My two stars are generous.

However, they have another location close to the Embarcadero where the food is delicious.  Try out that one.
author: Clever Chick I.

description: I drive by every week, never crowded and today wanted to stop being curious if good or not. Chicken kebab plate, kibbe plate and falafel  wrap. I smothered the dry falafel with yogurt because it was salty. The chicken had a nice grilled taste and was moist. Kibbe was good and made up for bad rice, baba ghanoush, and hummus. The $4.50 Specialty tea drink with chia was fizzy (it is highly perishable) and then my friend noticed that the drink expired that day. The girl at the counter tells me that it is supposed to taste that way. I won't be back.
author: Mo O.

description: I've always loved Mediterranean (especially when it's fast) & this spot allowed me to grab a quick bite. The chicken Shawarma was very tasty, but it was the male clerk behind the counter that truly made the experience as he did not stop smiling. It's amazing how much impact a simple "smile" has on a customer - it could change your whole day. I believe his name was "Akmei". He was delightful.
author: Jules F.

description:
We had some time to kill, and wanted a good gyro and hummus.  We ordered two gyros without onions, two orders of fries and an order of hummus and were disappointed in nearly all of it.  The gyro meat was chewy with an unexpected texture, the gyro itself had way too much sauce.  The hummus was as bland as day-old oatmeal and just as tasteless - I don't know, but it tasted like it was poured from a can.  The fries were fried up on-order, so they were decent.

The upside is that I picked up some kinder surprise eggs from my kids.
author: Travel A.

description:
My "First to Review"!! This place use to be Jollibees. Just came in for lunch today since it's right by my office (eating the gyro right now actually). Kinda pricey for the type of food you're getting but everything in this neighborhood is kinda pricey due to the convention center. The menu starts at ~ $8 and it goes up from there. There were four employees behind the counter so they were moving the lunch line pretty quick. Got the beef and lamb gyro ($7.75), decent but a bit too salty for my taste.

Need agua.
author: Terence H.

description: Awesome chicken kabob salad. I've paid a lot more for a lot less in quality and quantity. Tasty, fast and reasonable price.
author: Lilly J.

description: Two stars for opening late. The food is shit though.
author: Ross P.

description:
I really wanted to like Oasis Grill, but the $9.30 chicken shawerma sandwich was not up to par. The chicken was under seasoned and the only other things in the sandwich were lettuce, two slices of tomato, chicken, and a tiny bit of hummus. Sorry, but that doesn't cut it for me. 

Besides that, I ordered behind a couple of ladies who were ordering for their office and so placed 5 orders. But after they got their 5 sandwiches, 10 people who were behind me got their sandwiches (some, the same chicken shawerma) first before me! They need to figure out a better way to keep their little bags with orders on them in the correct order to avoid pissing people off.

All in all, sorry Oasis Grill, but I'll stick to Gyro King down the street in the Civic Center. Way better food and you can't beat the price ($6.25 for a chicken gyros wrap--very similar to the shawerma).
author: Sahar B.

description: Love the Shawarma and Gyros wraps here. I order mine spicy, think Sriracha hot. Always freshly made and quick enough I always forget to check-in.  Try the Baklava.
author: Rick B.

description: Not good. Every ingredient in the falafel wrap--including the falafel & the lavash bread--was stone cold. One extra star for decent tasting tahini sauce, but the tiny wrap only deserves one star. Would rather take my chances at the Metreon food court from now on.
author: Wan T.

description: Sandwiches were good. Not all menu items are available at lunch :(. Watch out, once you get to the end they drip and explode sauce like crazy
author: SnwBuni M.

description: Great people and service. Veg.medi. wrap. was carefully prepared with fresh ingredients. Liquid yogurt was great.
author: D P.

description: Love this place.. and the one on Drumm. I always get beef and lamb gyro... extra spicy. Good food. Nice people.
author: Justin D.

description:
Wow!  Delicious and healthy food served by very nice people!  The next time we go we will take as many folks along as we can - we'd love to see this wonderful business thrive and grow.  

The food was absolutely deliriously spiced and seasoned.  We left feeling good and sated.
author: D G.

description: I come here for lunch just about once a week. I love Med food and grew up with my grandma making it. This place does a great job and is very fairly priced. I dropped it down just one star because it's not quite as authentic as how my grandma cooks, but it is still fantastic!
author: Megan B.

description: It was my first time to try their falafel and shawarma. The taste of these wraps is Ok i expect a better spicy mediterranean taste. The size of the sandwich is large and its a little bit pricy, and the service is average.
author: Li A.

description: The chicken shawarma is okay, as is the "russian salad" (potato salad). A tad expensive, IMHO.
author: Maximillian M.

description: The food is tasty.  However, for the price, the portions are too small.  I spent $8.49 ($10 with tax and tip) for a chicken schwarma.  Like I said it was tasty, but the size was smallish, such that I am still hungry.  I don't want to spend $10 and still be hungry for a take out lunch.
author: Karl B.

description: What a prime location, right outside the Moscone Center.  I'm assuming this place must be crawling with convention-goers, like it was at Intersolar.  Why anyone would pass up this place for the GOD AWFUL prison-food served at the portable vendors inside the convention halls is completely beyond me.  It's relatively fast (considering the long line out the door), the beef shawarma was juicy, and overall a pretty decent experience.  Now... would I be as thrilled if I weren't a starved dog from sitting at my booth all day?  Probably not, and that might account for the sub-3 stars from other reviewers, but IF YOU'RE HERE ATTENDING A SHOW, AND DON'T HAVE TIME TO SIT DOWN AT A NICE PLACE, DO EAT HERE.  You'll appreciate the advice, and you can thank me later.
author: Jeff J.

description: Poor customer service. Very pricey for the amount of food. Graffiti all over dirty bathroom.
author: A W.

description: Beef and lamb gyro. Meat was tough, spice was lacking (ordered it spicy). Overall extremely bland. Never again.
author: Michael G.

description: Yummy falafel wrapped in lavash with hummus and lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber and yogurt sauce.  The texture of the falafel balls was perfect. But the BF was not a fan of the gyro because it came in lavash (not pita) and there "wasn't enough meat" for my meat-eater.
author: Julie M.

description: Least flavorful Greek meal you could encounter. The falafel was rock solid on the outside and slightly undercooked on the inside not to mention brow raisingly expensive.
author: Greg A.

description: Terrible customer service!!! I called requesting an itemized receipt, repeatedly I might add, and they never responded. I've been calling all week because I need it in order to process a reimbursement, and the ghetto waitstaff just gave me attitude. God help you if you need a receipt for reimbursement and forget to ask for one. You'll be s*** out of luck.
author: Carol F.

description: Had the beef shawarma wrap- wonderful- definitely say yes to spicy!  Greek salad was good- pretty standard, but tasted very fresh and light. Hummus was aiight, but we had to ask for something to dip it in.
author: Ashley F.

description: Solid add to a lunchtime rotation.  Avoid during conventions given the lines.  Food is fresh and looking forward to their new location.
author: mike s.

description: Expensive and dirty for a fast food. Every table is dirty and trash overflowing. Not impreseed.
author: J E.

description: I never write reviews on Yelp.  Ever.  I was to compelled to write a review for this place because it was the BEST Falafel plate that I have had in years.  The falafel, babganoush, hummus, and salads were fresh and tasty.  Only $10 for a large portion.  I'm not sure why there are below average reviews. Perhaps the other items are not as good.
author: Mona P.

description: As a picky eater I was a little skeptical about middle eastern food but after popping my first freshly fried falafel in my mouth I was hooked! my sister got a chicken shwarma and loved it also. The employees were very friendly and helpful and I loved the selection of chocolate next to the cash register. Nice reggae type music softly playing in the background. Overall I can't wait to go back!!
author: Caroline R.

description:
Tourist / conventioneer trap!!! Stay away!

The most disorganized "restaurant" I've ever seen in my life.
I placed my order and paid with a $20 bill--the cashier promptly took the money and then walked away!  No change, no receipt, no thank you.  Another woman eventually walked over and gave me a blank stare--I finally had to ask for my $8 change.  To make matters worse, they managed to lose my order (surprise surprise).  I had to stand there and watch while 10 people placed and subsequently received their orders.  I told them that I thought they lost my order---more blank stares.  I would have asked for my money back, but the food actually looked good and I was hungry---WRONG!   The food is just as bad as the service.  The chicken shawarma was mealy and tasteless. Like another reviewer said--it's stewed first and then heated on the grill.  Also, the wrap was as dry as cardboard. I'm still sick thinking about it.   

This place survives solely based on its proximity to Moscone center.
author: Sam K.

description: me and the cast of "Bite Me" went over because it was the closest spot to our hotel and it was raining.  I was iffy about the spot walking towards it, but I must say I was happy.  The food was authentic and tasty.  The workers were nice and very accommodating.  I got the gyro meal and it was worth the 8 dollars i spent.  I've been to other places that served Mediterranean food and it was just over priced and not good at all!  I'd come back
author: Donald R.

description: Great food, great for catering. My favorites are the shawarma plate and the falafel!
author: Leah M.

description: So I have been sort of cautious of this area for a bit. Things pop up and usually are ok. But this place was actually pretty decent. I came here for a gyro and it was pretty good. They do the lavash style, not pita. Ask for spicy and what do you get ... spicy :)
author: Greg G.

description: Chicken Kebabs are delish! Perfectly seasoned & served w your choice of 6 different salads. Yummy!
author: April F.

description: I was wandering off from Market street a little before 21:00 when I noticed it on the corner and decided to try it. The interior is bright and open, though it is not big. The floor layout is a bit odd. I ordered the Kefka Kabob plate. Ordering was a breeze. The attendant is attentive and friendly. I did see him help the next customer figure out coin denominations. The cook staff was not very fast and tended to get distracted. Maybe it was because it was the end of their night? I got my meal it was in a portable plastic clam shell. The meat was served on a bed of veggies over rice. A cucumber yogurt, red cabbage slaw and hummus accompanied the plate. In the center there was pocket with a generous portion of sirracha/hot sauce.  The portions seemed good. The kefka was delicious, moist and spiced nicely. The rice was tender and tasty. The hummus was good. I am not much of a humus nut, but enjoyed with the pita. It did seem zestier than most others. A very tasty satisfying meal.
author: Angel B.

description:
I am from Phoenix AZ and was there for a conference last weekend, this place has been a life saver for me. The food is of great quality, and well priced in the middle of the business district of SF. The owner Hisham was on top of everything, lunch time when hundreds of people were looking for lunch, he was taking care of everybody. The line was down the street and he was running between all people taking their orders so you don't wait too long.
Now the food, get the plates not the sandwichs, there is lot more value in the plates and you get Hummus, salad, Tabbouleh, rice and much more. Hisham was very nice he offered my elderly dad extra rice and pita bread. The grilled mix is absolutely worth it and the Mezza plate (has falafel, hummus, etc...) a veggie plate is an excellent choice too. The meat is tender and delicious, the falafel is amazing too.
The prices ranged from $8 for sandwiches to $13-17 for the plates, but it is absolutely worth it.
I will go back there again for sure
author: M A.

description: Halal meat is served here, per signs outside restaurant. Was pleasantly surprised to see the Oasis Grill sign on my way home from SF.  We had to stop and pick up some chicken wrap melts (chicken kebab wraps with cheese) to go.  Great stuff.  Parking is hard to find at this location.  Limited seating inside, so more of a take-out place.
author: Irfan R.

description: Compared to the location on Drumm the chicken shawarma wrap from this spot wasn't quite as big/generous, but still just as tasty. Extra space in this restaurant  (again, compared to Drumm) makes it much more inviting - less hectic feeling. Great addition to the neighborhood.
author: J. R.

description: Went in for a quick lunch and I can say as a positive, they were prompt with getting our food out.  But the food itself was not good.  We ordered two greek salads with gyro meat on top.  The dressing had no flavor at all and the gyro meat tasted and looked like something you would get from a mall food court - not freshly carved from the rotisserie.  The feta was so mild that it was almost flavorless as well.  There was really nothing I liked about the meal and at $28 for the salads an Orangina and a bottled water, we were very disappointed.  We won't be back. (I guess I am a little spoiled - we have a fantastic greek place closer to home and everything is compared to it.  But honestly - the food was bland and blah.)
author: Allegra G.

description: The falafel is okay, The gyro is dry and flavorless. I've given them two chances, and I won't be going back
author: Britt T.

description: I had the $12 kebab salad. Tasty, Yes. Good Service, Yes. I knocked one star off because if a salad is going to be $12, it should be much bigger. Otherwise, great experience.
author: Stan W.

description: I've been to Oasis Grill in Hayward and that restaurant is fantastic! Here in SF I decided I'd give this place a try, not once, but twice. Each time I've reminded myself not to go back.  For $9 I got the beef and lamb gyro. Last time I had the chicken shwarma...not good. The meat used is precut, grabbed from a container and reheated on the grill. It's tasteless and has similar texture to a garden burger, and tastes just as bland. What saves the gyro (wrap) from complete failure is the sauce, but in terms of value and taste $9 is steep, and it's not even downtown. The gyro needs to be bigger, and have more taste, before I'd really want to shell out $9 again. Staff also seems more preoccupied with personal matters and chit chat amongst themselves.
author: Marcus C.

description: Went to oasis expecting a great food experience across from Moscone center. I ordered the chicken schwarma plate. Why they call it that. It could not be further from the real dish. The chicken had some sort if coating on it. The chicken was tasteless and dry. The young staff did not seem knowledgeable or helpful. I would not recommend.
author: Mike R.

description: Jolibee's was out of place at this location. Service was good, couldn't decide which wrap and person making them said get the chicken. Either was overcooked or days old. Was very, very dry.
author: Aaron S.

description: Ate there with my now former girlfriend. The food is fantastic and the people who work there are wonderful and accomodating. If only the former GF had fit that description :)
author: A. D.

description: Was nervous because it looked like it was designed for speed not quality.  It was both fast and good. Lamb gyros, fries and rings were just right. Price is median for sf
author: Bruce M.

description:
Only a small area with 2 chairs to wait for your food. The park is close so you can go eat there, or the peir...
Anyway, I ordered the Maui? something? it was $10... I thought it was a bit pricey but it says half chicken with rice and salad, so I gave it a whirl thinking I'd share it with my 16 month old. 
I was asked if I wanted is plain, a little spicy, or really spicy. I chose "a little" and it was perfect. Even my 16 month old had some and it was fine for her too.
The chicken was a little dry, but thats what happens with cut up chicken right after it's cooked usually. Veggies were mixed in a bit over done, but still good. I chose the greek salad and tabouli salad to go with it. The tabouli went well with the dish (cooling when the spice started adding up) The greek salad was just salad with tomatoe and bell pepper and olive oil. :-/ They should take out the bell pepper and add feta cheese and olives (thats GREEK salad!)
Over all it was still pretty good. I ate it ALL. It was a lot of food! The chicken and rice part reminded me a bit of chicken cacciatore, minus the tomatoe sauce of course.
I'd gladly order it again.
My husband ordered a chicken shawarma and said they suck at making them. He said it wasn't even close to being a shawarma and that they added the tabouli salad to it when he asked for the greek.
I would of taken another star off for his experience, but I was too busy stuffing my face with my chicken cacciatore...er...maui something or other...
This place is also Halal :)
author: Crystal C.

description: Not sure what cuisine this is. It is not Middle Eastern by any stretch of the imagination. I am from the middle East and was dumb founded by there food. The sandwiches are a disaster. The "gyro" is a fromed kafte patty and not cut from a vertical grill. The mixed grill pieces of meat were tiny for the $16.00 and the kafte was the thickness of beef jerky.
author: bassam l.

description: I am so happy to have the Oasis Grill in SOMA!  It replaced the horrible Filipino burger joint that previously occupied the space on the corner of Howard & 4th.  The service is fast and friendly and the food is fresh and really good.  They seem to have a steady flow of customers.  Best of all, it has awesome falafel wraps served on a lavash.  I think they acquired more store space, because they have a dining area offering plenty of seating.
author: Sandra M.

description: Beef Sharama was good, extra spicy. tahini and hummus on the pita. fries were fresh and crispy. grabbed another to take on the plane. enjoyed that one too
author: Lawrence P.

description:
I was thrilled when another Oasis Grill opened, i am a big fan of the original one on Drumm Street but it was a bit of a walk. so now i have been to this one couple of times, while the food is generally tastes the same the service is awful. Just today it took them 10 minutes to take my order and i was the ONLY person in the line. they are almost clueless for some reason even though there were 4-5 people working behind the scenes.
Another good thing about this place would have been the fact that there is place to sit, however they do not clean up often at ALL. there was food scrap all over the floor in more than a few places.
we ordered falafels and asked for both to be extra spicy, when we got to eating them the spice levels were way off - one was extra extra spicy and the other one just a little.
maybe having some folks from the Drumm location teaching them how to do stuff could help. i will most likely walk a little more to Drumm location.
author: Dinesh R.

description: The only thing halal about this place was the meat and that they didn't serve alcohol. It was the rudest service I've ever received at a halal restaurant in my life, and was treated different from the other customers. When I ordered they didn't bring the food to my table or call my name. It wasn't until 15-20 minutes of me waiting did I walk over and ask where my food was and they said it was sitting there--no longer hot by then. Thinking it was my fault for not hearing my order being called I took it and said nothing. Then I noticed the employees delivered the food to the tables of all the other customers. My boyfriend noticed it too and asked the employee if they brought food to the customers when they ordered...he said they did and did not answer him when he asked why we were treated differently. Right when that happened I noticed hair in my pita bread then threw it in the compost bin in frustration. The most disappointing thing was that I really wanted to support this restaurant and have them cater events I organize but I guess that won't happen.
author: Catherine M.

description: I went for lunch at around noon on Monday, 9 December.  The place is OK -- nothing special.  It is a small place and suffers from a lack of organization.  I ate a gyro wrap, which was very unremarkable.  Convenient to Moscone Convention Centre.
author: Danny B.

description: Went back recently and the falafel just tasted like flour. Sure, it can re-bind an overly moist mixture, but it won't make it taste like $8.20.
author: Nicholas J.

description: I came here looking for something nice and heavy to hit the spot.  What I got was a gyro with barely 3 pieces of meat in it, it was barely warm, and I could see the guy basically reheating the meat over the grill (he was not cutting it off the big slab of meat which gives it that juicy flavor).  The tzatziki on the gyro was good, and the veggies were fresh, but I wouldn't go back and pay $9 for that. Pretty much the hot sauce and tzatziki were the only reasons it had any flavor.
author: Megha A.

description: the worst shawerma sandwich ever , cheap ingredients the meat was not cooked well ,  the sandwich didnt have any tabouli or baba ghanouch ,  i say it again the worst shawerma ever , also is so expensive for the kind of ingredient , not worth it , never go again
author: Walid H.

description: Meh. Veggie plate was mostly chopped up cukes, not much delicious hummus, etc.
author: Elise A.

description: Food was great. The b---h at the counter treated us like she hated us. Unbelievable! Don't go there late or you will up-set the fuzzy headed b---h.
author: Dennis B.

description:
Clean, earnest, prompt, courteous and very fast. Now for the food:
Fresh, yes, but flavor? Salt, garlic and onion - don't be afraid of them! Cucumber salad was completely bland - could have used lemon juice and salt AND olive oil. Kefta Kebab Lavash Wrap had flavors of tahini sauce, grilled lavash bread, fresh crispy romaine and tomato - and halfway through the wrap the meat vanished.
Now for the meat:
I got the PLAIN Kefta Kebab - no "hot sauce". The Kefta Kebab is missing the flavors of a seasoned meat - such as garlic, onion or even drippings of beef and lamb. It tasted sauteed not grilled. Where's the flavor? Fat? Richness?
I can see plenty of chopped parsley, bits if red and the meat is soft and finely ground. yet it is neither pink nor brown - neither tastes cooked or raw. I do however get large bits of gristle throughout. Also, the meat is distributed at the ends and is missing from the middle. I'd put up with all of that if it just had great flavor. How about salt and garlic?
However the pre-packaged "nut bars" in front of the cash register, especially the sesame bars, are spectacular - soft and chewy, for $2 apiece.
I could have gone to Ayola on 2nd for a really flavorful "kebab".
author: Nan L.

description: Was in town for business and had a craving for Greek food. Read the reviews online and thought I would try Oasis. Walked in and was greeted with "Yes"? I saw that they offered shish taouk so I ordered it. When my order was ready they called it out and as I walked up to the counter my food container was tossed to me. Now the Shish taouk was good along with the rice and tabuli. When I was done there was no thank you or come again. Overall, the food was ok but service was poor.
author: Rene A.

description: The beef shwarma is very good, as are many of the vegetarian items.  This is a hole in the wall type place that has good food and little else, but for a quick lunch, that's all you need.  They sell interesting world candies, but they are overpriced (almost as much as some of the meals).  The cleanliness of the restaurant isnt great either, but the food is!
author: Andy F.

description: Tough meat, meat-to-veggie ratio was not good, the one tomato was grainy.  The sauce looks like it's going to be good but is tasteless. Definitely not worth $9.
author: holly a.

description: Visited several times in January 2012, enjoyed very much. A bit pricey but so is the city. I also recommend kombucha drink they sell.
author: Ivan G.

description: I ate here for the first time yesterday with my boyfriend and we were both very happy with the service and food. It is difficult to find something we both agree on because I'm a vegetarian and he loves meat. This restaurant has options for both of us and the staff is knowledgable and friendly  so we will be back soon!
author: D d.
